abstract.p: Visteon Corp, automotive systems supplier, announces accord with Lucent Technologies to develop wireless communications systems for vehicles called Bluetooth (S)

block.p: The Visteon Corporation, an automotive systems supplier, announced an accord with Lucent Technologies yesterday to develop a wireless communications systems for vehicles called Bluetooth. With the deal, whose financial terms were not disclosed, Visteon seeks to offer interaction between cars and devices like mobile phones and personal digital assistants. Bluetooth is a wireless networking system, primarily used to connect electronic devices that transmit small amounts of data. Martin Reynolds, a research fellow at Gartner Dataquest in San Jose, Calif., said such technology would not appear in most cars for at least two years.
